title: idea: rerun with partial (only new or changed) inputs
body:
use case: currently we have 100 files on which we would like to run a command which takes them as its argument, so we would specify `--input sub-*/anat/*nii.gz` and command would be `thecommand -o {outputs} {inputs}`. And processing of each input is lengthy.

Later we will acquire 100 more files, and would like to rerun the command (`rerun INITIALRUNREVISION`) providing it only with new (not previously present) files.  Under assumption that command works reproducibly (could be a container etc), it would be great if rerun somehow could provide `thecommand` only with `inputs` which are files not previously present/processed (i.e. present in the INITIALRUNREVISION or any subsequent rerun of that command).

If there would be support to somehow do it, in that mode rerun could also verify that there were no changes to those `inputs` which were present in initial run(s) commit(s), and either blow if any of the inputs changed since then or have a mode to rerun on only modified files.
